title: 106_s2111
content: LAND CONVEYANCE AND SETTLEMENT, SAN BERNARDINO NATIONAL FOREST, CALIFORNIA. The Secretary of Agriculture will convey approximately 1.06 acres of real property in San Bernardino National Forest to KATY 101.3 FM. The legal description will be prepared by mutual agreement, and the consideration will be based on the appraised fair market value. The Secretary will convey 1.06 acres of real property in San Bernardino National Forest to KATY 101.3 FM based on the appraised fair market value. KATY will pay $16,600 to be released from any claims by the United States for site use. Access over National Forest System lands is not required for the conveyed property. KATY will bear administrative costs for creating a subdivided parcel and assume liability for the conveyed property, indemnifying the United States. Funds received will be deposited as per Public Law 90. Funds received from the conveyance of property will be deposited in the fund established under Public Law 90-171 (Sisk Act) for the acquisition of lands for the San Bernardino National Forest. Amendments are made to the Receipts Act regarding the approval process for land acquisitions. Amendments are made to the Receipts Act for the San Bernardino National Forest, including changes to counties covered and fund allocation. The Senate passed S. 2111 on October 5, 2000, directing the Secretary of Agriculture to convey 1.06 acres of land in the San Bernardino National Forest, California, to KATY 101.3 FM for fair market value.
